channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: 22 new community cases ahead of alert level decision
item.description: Five of the new cases have yet to be linked to the current outbreak, officials have announced, hours ahead of a Government decision on alert levels.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19 NZ: Auckland lockdown alert level decision to be announced at 4pm
item.description: Cabinet faces its toughest call on Covid-19 yet as it decides whether or not to take Auckland out of lockdown.
item.dc:creator: HENRY COOKE

item.title: Covid-19: 22 new cases ahead of alert level decision for Auckland
item.description: There are 22 new cases of Covid-19, as Cabinet will decide this afternoon whether Auckland will stay in alert level 4 or move to level 3.
item.dc:creator: HANNAH MARTIN

item.title: Covid-19: Waikato leaders angry at Government officials for allowing man to bring coronavirus across border
item.description: Outraged community leaders expect to see Auckland's outbreak border shifted south to cover parts of Hauraki.
item.dc:creator: LAWRENCE GULLERY

item.title: Mangatangi School dad: 'Officials seem to have dropped the ball'
item.description: Father-of-two who lives a few clicks south of Auckland's Covid-19 border is annoyed that officials appear to have exposed his community to Delta.
item.dc:creator: JO LINES-MACKENZIE

item.title: Covid-19: Cabinet could make ‘cautious' alert level decision to extend Auckland lockdown, adding Waikato, expert says
item.description: Professor Michael Baker says Cabinet might take the cautious approach to extend Auckland's lockdown for another week and add parts of the Waikato after household members of a remand prisoner tested positive in the region — including a pupil who was symptomatic at school.
item.dc:creator: COLLETTE DEVLIN

item.title: Driver, 82, taken to hospital after car rolls in Mangorei Rd, New Plymouth
item.description: A male driver was taken to hospital with moderate injuries after his vehicle ended up on its roof.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: DOC should chip in for flood protection work – Harihari farmers
item.description: The Department of Conservation should help foot the bill for flood protection on land it leases out in South Westland, a Harihari farmer says.
item.dc:creator: LOIS WILLIAMS LOCAL DEMOCRACY REPORTER

item.title: Sex offender to serve home detention for grooming girl to perform lewd act
item.description: The victim didn't realise the man's actions were wrong until learning at school about inappropriate behaviour.
item.dc:creator: JIMMY ELLINGHAM

item.title: Covid-19: 'Level 4 anxiety' as Waikato residents line up to be tested
item.description: They're still in level 2 but nervousness has spread through residents of Mangatangi and Kaiaua after news of cases in their midst.
item.dc:creator: JO LINES-MACKENZIE

item.title: Mitsubishi confirms pricing for new Outlander
item.description: Mitsubishi has confirmed the pricing of its new Outlander as the first shipments arrive in New Zealand.
item.dc:creator: NILE BIJOUX

item.title: Greymouth floodwalls – who should pay ?
item.description: Rating changes that will spread the cost of flood protection in Greymouth don't go far enough, says the man who oversaw the building of the town's floodwalls 30 years ago.
item.dc:creator: LOIS WILLIAMS LOCAL DEMOCRACY REPORTER

item.title: Stockmarket on the up, now waiting on alert level decision
item.description: OPINION: However there are no ‘free lunches’, and inflation, along with debt levels, is spiralling higher.
item.dc:creator: GREG SMITH

item.title: Pāua poacher who donned a wig to trick fisheries officers wins appeal
item.description: A Taranaki pāua poacher who dressed in disguise in an unsuccessful attempt to fool fishery officers looking for him has had his convictions quashed.
item.dc:creator: TARA SHASKEY

item.title: Witnesses sought after Kawerau hit-and-run
item.description: A woman has been airlifted to hospital after a hit-and-run incident in Kawerau on Monday morning
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Relative of Covid-positive prisoner questions why case was not tested before release
item.description: The relative says the family is "scared" after three children were taken into quarantine after testing positive for the virus.
item.dc:creator: GEORGE BLOCK

item.title: November and December MIQ spots gone in 67 minutes, thousands miss out
item.description: “I don’t want Christmas this year,” says crying mother, as all hope of a managed isolation spot for her son this year evaporates.
item.dc:creator: TOM HUNT

item.title: Life, the universe and everything - including a giant octopus - in Hamilton after dark
item.description: Three very different but intriguing interactive sculptures have turned central Hamilton into an environment of mystery and wonderment at night.
item.dc:creator: MIKE MATHER

item.title: Covid-19: MIQ booking system a 'joke', leaving family in Melbourne heartbroken, hopeless
item.description: At 17,865th in the managed isolation booking queue, Jenny May Wilson’s​ hope of coming back to New Zealand quickly fizzled.
item.dc:creator: BRITTNEY DEGUARA

item.title: The Crown will not fund Christchurch stadium's extra $50 million cost
item.description: The decision shuts off one option the Christchurch City Council was pursuing in a bid to plug the project’s $50m hole.
item.dc:creator: STEVEN WALTON
